title: Feature: Cambridge English Entry Test Creator with AI
description:
## Summary

Create an AI-powered Cambridge English placement test system that establishes student English proficiency levels according to CEFR standards (A1-C2). The system uses OpenRouter for LLM access and Cartesia for audio generation.

## Problem Statement

Currently, there is no standardized way to assess incoming students' English proficiency levels. Teachers and admins need a reliable, automated way to:
- Place new students at the appropriate learning level
- Generate customized tests for companies or individuals
- Provide detailed skill breakdowns for personalized learning paths

## Feature Components

### 1. Test Generation with AI
- **OpenRouter Integration**: Access multiple LLMs via OpenRouter API
- **Model Selector**: Dropdown with full OpenRouter LLM list
- **Default Model**: Claude Opus 4.5 (claude-opus-4-5-20250101)
- **Custom Prompt Box**: Detailed instructions for test generation
- **Personalization**: Generate tests tailored to specific companies or individual students

### 2. Cambridge English Levels (CEFR)
- A1 (Beginner)
- A2 (Elementary)
- B1 (Intermediate)
- B2 (Upper-Intermediate)
- C1 (Advanced)
- C2 (Proficiency)

### 3. Question Types
- **Reading Comprehension**: Passages with multiple choice questions
- **Grammar**: Fill-in-the-blank, error correction, sentence transformation
- **Vocabulary**: Word matching, synonyms/antonyms, context usage
- **Listening/Audio**: Audio questions using Cartesia TTS
- **Writing**: Short essay prompts, email writing
- **Speaking Prompts**: Topics for verbal assessment (avatar sessions)

### 4. Audio Integration (Cartesia)
- Generate audio for listening comprehension questions
- Text-to-speech for instructions and passages
- Multiple accents/voices available

### 5. Test Customization Options
- Company-specific tests (business English, industry vocabulary)
- Individual student focus areas
- Adjustable difficulty and question count
- Time limits per section

### 6. Evaluation & Scoring
- Automatic scoring for objective questions (MCQ, fill-in-blank)
- AI-assisted evaluation for written responses
- CEFR level recommendation based on overall scores
- Detailed breakdown by skill area
- Confidence scores and improvement areas

### 7. Admin Interface
- LLM model selector (OpenRouter list)
- Detailed prompt input box
- Question type toggles
- Company/student selector
- Preview and edit generated tests
- Save test templates

### 8. Student Test-Taking Interface
- Clean, distraction-free test environment
- Progress indicator
- Timer (optional)
- Audio playback controls
- Submit and review functionality

## Technical Requirements

### APIs
- OpenRouter API for LLM access (multi-model)
- Cartesia API for audio generation

### Database (Convex)
- New tables: tests, testQuestions, testResults, testTemplates
- Relations to students and companies
- Real-time progress tracking

### Frontend
- Admin: Test creation/management pages in /admin/tests
- Student: Test-taking interface at /test/[testId]

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Admin can select LLM model from OpenRouter list
- [ ] Admin can write custom prompts for test generation
- [ ] System generates valid CEFR-aligned questions
- [ ] All 6 question types are supported
- [ ] Cartesia generates audio for listening sections
- [ ] Tests can be customized per company or student
- [ ] Automatic scoring works for objective questions
- [ ] AI evaluates written responses with feedback
- [ ] Student receives CEFR level recommendation
- [ ] Test results stored in Convex with detailed breakdown
- [ ] Admin can save and reuse test templates

## Out of Scope (for initial implementation)
- Adaptive testing (adjusting difficulty in real-time)
- Video-based questions
- Proctoring/cheating detection
- Integration with external certification bodies

title: Feature: Audio-Only Lesson Mode - Add option to run lessons with audio only (no avatar video)
description:
## Summary

Add an explicit 'audioOnly' mode for lessons that uses TTS audio with a static avatar image instead of rendering the Beyond Presence video avatar. This mode can be selected when creating lessons to:
- Save on Beyond Presence API costs
- Work when avatar video quota is exceeded
- Provide a lighter-weight lesson experience

## Background

The Python agent already has audio-only fallback code (lines 1284-1447 in apps/agent/main.py) that activates when Beyond Presence fails (quota exceeded, auth error, rate limited, etc.). This feature request is to make audio-only mode an intentional, configurable option rather than just a fallback.

## Implementation Tasks

### 1. Schema Updates (convex/schema.ts)
- Add `audioOnly: v.optional(v.boolean())` to `structuredLessons` table
- Add `audioOnly: v.optional(v.boolean())` to `sessions` table

### 2. Session Creation Updates (convex/sessions.ts)
- Modify `createFromStructuredLesson` to pass through `audioOnly` flag to session
- Ensure `createSession` accepts optional `audioOnly` parameter

### 3. Admin UI Updates (app/(dashboard)/admin/lessons/page.tsx or related)
- Add toggle/checkbox for "Audio Only Mode" when creating a structured lesson
- Include tooltip explaining: "Uses TTS audio with static avatar image instead of video avatar. Saves API costs."

### 4. Frontend Lesson Room Updates
- Modify lesson room component to check session.audioOnly flag
- When audioOnly=true:
  - Display static avatar image (from avatar.appearance.avatarImage) instead of video track
  - Hide/disable avatar video track subscription
  - TTS audio still plays normally
- Reference existing components:
  - components/lesson/lesson-room.tsx
  - components/lesson/teaching-room.tsx

### 5. Python Agent Updates (apps/agent/main.py)
- Read `audioOnly` flag from session data (fetched via Convex client)
- When audioOnly=true:
  - Skip Beyond Presence avatar initialization entirely (don't even attempt)
  - Set `audio_only_mode = True` at the start
  - Use existing audio-only code path
- This avoids wasting API calls and reduces startup latency

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Admin can toggle "Audio Only" when creating a structured lesson
- [ ] When audioOnly lesson is started, frontend shows static avatar image
- [ ] TTS audio plays normally in audioOnly mode
- [ ] Python agent skips avatar video initialization for audioOnly sessions
- [ ] Existing fallback behavior still works when avatar fails unexpectedly
- [ ] No regression to normal avatar video lessons

## Technical Notes

- Avatar static images are stored in `avatar.appearance.avatarImage` field
- The existing `audio_only_mode` variable in main.py should be set based on session config
- Session data is already fetched via ConvexClient in the agent
- Consider adding visual indicator in lesson UI showing "Audio Only Mode" to student

## Related Files

- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/convex/schema.ts` - Database schema
- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/convex/sessions.ts` - Session mutations/queries
- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/apps/agent/main.py` - Python agent (lines 1284-1447 for existing fallback)
- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/components/lesson/lesson-room.tsx` - Frontend lesson UI
- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/components/lesson/teaching-room.tsx` - Teaching room component

## Out of Scope

- Automatic switching between video and audio-only based on quota
- Per-session toggle (only per-lesson configuration for now)
- Audio-only for quick practice or free conversation (only structured lessons)

title: Test Agent Memory Systems (Knowledge Base + Zep Student Memory)
description:
Test and verify that both memory systems in the Beethoven agent are working correctly:

## Knowledge Base (RAG)
- Test that the agent can retrieve relevant information from uploaded knowledge bases
- Verify lesson content, vocabulary lists, grammar explanations are accessible
- Test retrieval accuracy and relevance

## Zep Memory (Student Memory)
- Test that student conversation history is being stored
- Verify the agent remembers previous interactions with specific students
- Test personalization based on student history (struggles, preferences, progress)
- Check that memory persists across sessions

## Testing Approach
- Run test conversations with the agent
- Query Zep Cloud to verify memory storage
- Test RAG retrieval from knowledge bases in Convex
- Check the agent logs for memory/RAG usage
- Document any issues found

## Relevant Code
- apps/agent/main.py (RAG retriever initialization, Zep setup)
- apps/agent/src/utils/ (convex_client.py for knowledge base access)
- convex/knowledgeBases.ts (knowledge base management)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Knowledge base retrieval returns relevant lesson content
- [ ] Zep stores conversation history correctly
- [ ] Agent demonstrates recall of previous student interactions
- [ ] Memory persists across multiple sessions
- [ ] All issues documented with reproduction steps

title: Student Evaluation & Progress Tracking System
description:
## Summary

Create a comprehensive and solid logic for evaluating students throughout their learning journey. This is a core platform feature that enables personalized learning paths and measurable progress tracking.

## Problem Statement

The platform currently lacks a unified evaluation system. While individual components exist (vocabularyProgress, exerciseProgress, session metrics), there is no:
- Unified proficiency assessment (CEFR A1-C2)
- Skill-specific progress tracking across multiple dimensions
- Trend analysis over time
- AI-powered evaluation of speaking/writing
- Personalized recommendations based on performance

## Existing Code Audit

**What already exists:**
- `convex/vocabularyProgress.ts` - SM-2 spaced repetition for vocabulary
- `convex/exerciseProgress.ts` - Exercise attempt tracking with scores
- `convex/sessions.ts` - Session metrics (wordsSpoken, newVocabulary, errorsCorreected, germanSupportUsed)
- `convex/schema.ts`:
  - `progress` table (skillType, level, experiencePoints)
  - `studentVocabulary` table (mastery tracking)
  - `errorPatterns` table (mistake tracking)
  - `memories` table (student fact extraction)
  - `userMemorySync` table (Zep integration with profileSummary including strongAreas, weakAreas)
- `students` table has: currentLevel, assessmentCompleted flag, totalLessonsCompleted, totalMinutesPracticed

**What's missing:**
- Composite scoring algorithms
- CEFR level calculation logic
- Skill radar breakdown (Reading, Writing, Listening, Speaking, Grammar, Vocabulary)
- Progress trend analysis
- AI-evaluated speaking/writing
- Student dashboard visualization components
- Entry test integration (links to beethoven-6pp)
- Periodic progress assessments
- Achievement/milestone system

## Feature Components

### 1. Evaluation Metrics
- **Overall proficiency level**: CEFR A1-C2 (calculated from skill breakdown)
- **Skill breakdown**: Reading, Writing, Listening, Speaking, Grammar, Vocabulary
- **Progress over time**: Trend analysis with daily/weekly/monthly views
- **Session-by-session performance**: Per-session scores and comparisons
- **Strengths/weaknesses identification**: AI-powered analysis

### 2. Data Points to Track
- Lesson completion rates and quality
- Quiz/test scores (from entry test - beethoven-6pp)
- Response accuracy during avatar sessions
- Speaking fluency metrics:
  - Hesitation frequency
  - Self-corrections
  - Response latency
  - German support usage ratio
- Vocabulary retention (already in SM-2 system)
- Time spent on tasks
- Error patterns and common mistakes (already tracked)

### 3. Evaluation Methods
- **Entry test (placement)**: Links to beethoven-6pp Cambridge English Test Creator
- **Ongoing formative assessment**: Real-time during avatar lessons
- **Periodic progress tests**: Scheduled assessments (weekly/monthly)
- **AI-evaluated speaking/writing**: Using LLM for qualitative feedback
- **Self-assessment options**: Student confidence ratings

### 4. Scoring & Weighting Logic
- Define scoring algorithms for each skill area
- Weight different assessment types appropriately:
  - Entry test: 30%
  - Ongoing performance: 50%
  - Periodic tests: 20%
- Normalize scores across different test types
- Calculate composite scores mapping to CEFR levels

### 5. Progress Visualization (Frontend)
- Student dashboard with progress charts
- Skill radar/spider charts (6 skills)
- Progress timeline with milestones
- Comparison to learning goals
- Achievement badges/milestones system

### 6. Feedback & Recommendations
- AI-generated feedback on performance
- Personalized learning recommendations
- Suggested focus areas based on weak points
- Recommended lessons/exercises from library

### 7. Integration Points
- Avatar session transcripts analysis (already captured)
- Lesson completion data from Convex (sessions table)
- Test results storage and retrieval
- Zep memory for long-term tracking (userMemorySync)
- Error patterns aggregation

## Technical Implementation

### Database Changes (Convex)
```
// New tables needed:
studentEvaluation - Composite scores and CEFR levels
skillScores - Per-skill tracking over time
assessmentResults - Entry test and periodic test results
achievements - Unlocked milestones
learningRecommendations - AI-generated suggestions
```

### New Convex Functions
- `evaluation/calculateCefrLevel` - Compute CEFR from skill scores
- `evaluation/updateSkillScores` - Update individual skills after sessions
- `evaluation/generateRecommendations` - AI recommendations
- `evaluation/getProgressTrend` - Time-series progress data
- `evaluation/recordAssessment` - Store test results

### Frontend Components
- `components/progress/SkillRadarChart.tsx`
- `components/progress/ProgressTimeline.tsx`
- `components/progress/AchievementBadges.tsx`
- `app/(dashboard)/progress/page.tsx` - Enhanced progress dashboard

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] CEFR level calculation works based on composite skill scores
- [ ] All 6 skills (R/W/L/S/G/V) tracked independently
- [ ] Session performance updates skill scores automatically
- [ ] Progress trends visible over time (week/month/all-time)
- [ ] AI generates actionable feedback after sessions
- [ ] Entry test results (from beethoven-6pp) integrated into evaluation
- [ ] Student dashboard shows skill radar chart
- [ ] Achievement/milestone system with unlockable badges
- [ ] Personalized lesson recommendations based on weak areas
- [ ] Error patterns inform vocabulary/grammar focus suggestions

## Dependencies

- **beethoven-6pp** (Feature: Cambridge English Entry Test Creator) - Required for entry placement test
- Zep memory system for long-term student profiling
- Avatar session transcript storage (already implemented)

## Out of Scope (Phase 1)

- Predictive analytics for learning outcomes
- Comparative benchmarking against other students
- External certification integration
- Parent/teacher reporting dashboards

title: Shareable Game Links for Client Sessions
description:
## Summary

Add the ability to generate unique shareable links for games so teachers can invite students/clients to play games together in real-time. This enables collaborative/multiplayer gameplay between teacher and student over the web.

## Background

The Beethoven platform already has a robust game system (components/games/) with multiple game types:
- SentenceBuilder, FillInBlank, WordOrdering, MatchingPairs
- WordScramble, MultipleChoice, Flashcards, Hangman, Crossword

Games are stored in the `wordGames` table with individual play sessions tracked in `gameSessions`. However, the current implementation only supports single-player mode. This feature extends the system to support real-time multiplayer sessions via shareable links.

## Requirements

### 1. Unique Token Generation
- Generate cryptographically secure tokens for game sessions
- Tokens should be URL-safe and reasonably short (e.g., 12-16 chars)
- Tokens must be indexed in database for fast lookup

### 2. Shareable URL Structure
- Create routes like `/games/play/[token]` for public game access
- URLs should work without authentication for invited clients
- Consider optional password protection for additional security

### 3. Real-time Multiplayer State
- Extend `gameSessions` table with multiplayer fields:
  - `shareToken`: unique token for the link
  - `hostUserId`: teacher/creator ID
  - `participants`: array of connected participants
  - `isMultiplayer`: boolean flag
  - `sharedState`: synchronized game state object
- Use Convex subscriptions for real-time state sync

### 4. Game State Synchronization
- Sync current question/card/item index across participants
- Sync answers and progress
- Handle turn-based vs concurrent gameplay modes
- Implement conflict resolution for simultaneous actions

### 5. UI for Link Generation
- Add "Share Game" button in admin/games interface
- Copy-to-clipboard functionality for the shareable URL
- Show QR code option for easy mobile joining
- Display list of active shared sessions

### 6. Join Flow for Clients
- Landing page at `/games/play/[token]`
- Prompt for name/nickname if not authenticated
- Display game waiting room until host starts
- Show participant list in real-time

## Technical Approach

### Database Changes (convex/schema.ts)
- Add `shareToken` field to `gameSessions` with unique index
- Add `multiplayerSessions` table or extend `gameSessions` with:
  - `hostUserId`, `participants`, `gameSettings`
  - `status`: "waiting", "active", "completed"

### New Convex Functions (convex/wordGames.ts)
- `createShareableSession`: Generate token, create session
- `joinSharedSession`: Add participant to session
- `getSessionByToken`: Lookup by share token
- `updateSharedGameState`: Sync state across participants
- `leaveSession`, `endSharedSession`

### Frontend Routes
- `app/(public)/games/play/[token]/page.tsx` - Public join page
- `app/(dashboard)/admin/games/[gameId]/share/page.tsx` - Share management

### Components
- `ShareGameDialog` - Modal with link generation UI
- `GameWaitingRoom` - Pre-game lobby
- `MultiplayerGameWrapper` - Real-time sync wrapper

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Teacher can click "Share" on any published game
- [ ] Unique shareable URL is generated and copyable
- [ ] Client can open link and join without creating account
- [ ] Teacher sees client join in real-time (participant list)
- [ ] Game state syncs in real-time between all participants
- [ ] Game works across all supported game types
- [ ] Host can end/close the shared session
- [ ] Tokens expire or can be manually revoked
- [ ] Session state persists if client briefly disconnects
- [ ] Works on mobile browsers

## Out of Scope (for initial version)

- Voice/video chat integration (use LiveKit separately)
- Score leaderboards between multiple students
- Game tournaments/competitions
- Replay/recording functionality
- Anonymous/guest host creation

## Related Files

- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/convex/wordGames.ts` - Game queries/mutations
- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/convex/schema.ts` - Database schema (lines 1127-1300)
- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/components/games/` - All game components
- `/Users/tomas/apps/beethoven/app/(dashboard)/admin/games/` - Admin game pages

## Estimated Effort

Medium complexity - 2-3 days
- Schema changes: 2-3 hours
- Convex functions: 4-6 hours
- Frontend routes/components: 8-12 hours
- Testing multiplayer sync: 4-6 hours
